column4: been googling to try get my iwl3945-based wlan card to see my home network (sometimes i see a random neighbour, sometimes none). is there hope?
i have the same card, no problems here
ubuntu 8.10 with 2.6.27-9-generic?
Intel Corporation PRO/Wireless 3945ABG [Golan] Network Connection (rev 02)
dang. you in the usa?
yes, why?
might be a regional thing. i noticed it configured for us, whereas on debian sid (where it works), it was za
so maybe i've just forgotten about something i tweaked somewhere
thanks, that's been helpful. means i should hack on. if you have a moment, i'd love to see your: dmesg | grep iwl3945.*Linux
sure, give a second
[   13.535951] iwl3945: Intel(R) PRO/Wireless 3945ABG/BG Network Connection driver for Linux, 1.2.26ks
okay, so it's gotta come down to a regional quirk
thanks, i'll see if i can remember how to zone the thing correctly
if you get it sorted, let me know what the problem was
*nods*
looks like two separate problems. 2.6.27 breaks support in iwl3945 for channels >11 (i was using 13), and you need to specify regional settings with a cfg80211 bootparam
http://www.linux-solved.com/post/solved-iwl3945-problem-after-upgrading-to-2-6-27-29338.html
ahh
brb, gonna test
confirmed. didn't have to play with the regdom, just changing channel was enough. how do i nominate this for inclusion in the release errata?
i have no idea, sorry
no worries, tomorrow is another day :)
new to ubuntu myself
